abstract: <jats:p> The complete amino acid sequence of the ribosomal A-protein (equivalent to L7/L12 in Escherichia coli) from a moderate halophile, NRCC 41227, has been determined using an automatic Beckman sequencer and by the manual Edman cleavage of peptides obtained from selective proteolytic cleavage of the ribosomal A-protein. The protein contains 122 amino acids and has a composition of Asp<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>, Asn<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>, Thr<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>, Ser<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>, Glu<jats:sub>21</jats:sub>, Gln<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>, Pro<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>, Gly<jats:sub>12</jats:sub>, Ala<jats:sub>21</jats:sub>, Val<jats:sub>14</jats:sub>, Met<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>, Ile<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>, Leu<jats:sub>9</jats:sub>, Phe<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>, Lys<jats:sub>11</jats:sub>, and Arg<jats:sub>1</jats:sub>, and a molecular weight of 12 537. It has a net negative charge of −14 and is, therefore, slightly more acidic than other eubacterial ribosomal A-proteins, The phylogenetic tree, obtained by computer analysis of the amino acid sequence of this and other eubacterial A-proteins, indicate these proteins form five subgroups within the eubacterial kingdom. The moderate halophile NRCC 41227 is part of a group of Gram-negative bacteria that include E. coli and another moderate halophile Vibrio costicola. The sequence data provides further evidence that the moderate and extreme halophiles have evolved by separate pathways. </jats:p>
title: The primary structure of the ribosomal A-protein (L12) from the moderate halophile NRCC 41227
